citeinfo.origin: Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA), Maizuru Marine Observatory
citeinfo.title: PM Line Phytoplankton Data of the Sea of Japan by Maizuru Marine Observatory

descript.abstract:
Maizuru Marine Observatory of the Japan Meteorological Agency has conducted routine oceanographic research cruises along the PM line for more than 30 years. PM line oceanographic data set were collected from R.V. Seifu-Maru II-II Ship Observation. The PM line is based on data taken at three stations; PM4, PM5, and PM6. Plankton data include diatom cell number and diatom species composition. The samples were collected at the surface.
[ Reference: PICES Scientific Report No. 18 2001, Proceedings of the PICES/CoML/IPRC Workshop on "Impact of Climate Variability on Observation and Prediction of Ecosystem and Biodiversity Changes in the North Pacific", http://www.pices.int/publications/scientific_reports/Report18/default.aspx. ]
descript.purpose: To study the decadal-scale ecosystem change at three of the PM stations located in the offshore Tsushima Current area.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system.
